title: Newsletter Issue - 16-04-2025
text:
CDT Weekly Newsletter




Message from the Director


Lunch and Learn Seminar


Student reps for next academic year




Welcome to this week’s issue of the newsletter.


Message from the Director

Thanks everyone for your engagement and input to what was a great Spring conference in a great venue. I really enjoyed it and so did the participating members of our advisory board. Special thanks to Andrew and Harry as student organisers, and Ole and Suzanne for making everything run so smoothly. Please don’t hesitate to post about it on your social networks. 

Lunch and Learn Seminar

There will be no Lunch and Learn Seminar this week. The next meeting will be on Wednesday 30 April.

Student reps for next academic year

It’s time to organise student reps for the next academic year, with two reps being needed for each cohort. Roles still to be filled for CDT23 and CDT22. Please email iai-cdt@bristol.ac.uk by 17 April if you are willing to take on the role.



Forthcoming Calendar of Events

Bristol Doctoral College (BDC) Events Calendar - 2025-04-18

title: Newsletter Issue - 01-05-2025
text:
CDT Weekly Newsletter




Jean Golding Institute Sustainable Innovation Lunch – Bristol


Workshop: How to Navigate the Middle Years of your Research Degree, online or in-person (hybrid session)




Welcome to this week’s issue of the newsletter.


Jean Golding Institute Sustainable Innovation Lunch – Bristol

Join us for this event to explore the resources to support researchers in developing breakthrough innovations and navigating their entrepreneurial journey. Focussing on opportunities in eco and sustainability innovation, we welcome academics from all disciplines interested in turning research into impact. Learn about funding, educational programs, and resources designed to accelerate innovation in your field. Nucleate Translate is an initiative designed to identify and bring together top-tier scientific and business talent who can contribute to research and science entrepreneurship within ARIA’s Opportunity Spaces. Nucleate Identify is powered through our partnership with the Advanced Research + Invention Agency (ARIA).

Workshop: How to Navigate the Middle Years of your Research Degree, online or in-person (hybrid session)

This workshop will help you navigate the ‘messy’ middle years of your research degree and provide strategies for juggling multiple strands of work. You will learn practical tips for organising your research, establishing goals and expectations, and applying project management strategies to your research.



Forthcoming Calendar of Events

Lunch and Learn Seminar - 2025-05-08Workshop: How to Navigate the Middle Years of your Research Degree, online or in-person (hybrid session) - 2025-05-28
